remarks: Combine two products into a single product over the cartesian product. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 1-Feb-2018.)
statement:
fprodxp.1 $e |- ( z = <. j , k >. -> D = C ) $.
fprodxp.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fprodxp.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. Fin ) $.
fprodxp.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. A /\ k e. B ) ) -> C e. CC ) $.
fprodxp $p |- ( ph -> prod_ j e. A prod_ k e. B C = prod_ z e. ( A X. B ) D ) $.
$d A j k z $.
$d B j k z $.
$d C z $.
$d D j k $.
$d j k ph z $.
